DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous tPA Thrombolytic Therapy Initiated at Hospital Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time of the day of  start use of infusions of fibrinolytic agents within a blood vessel to destroy or dissolve thrombi in blood vessels or bypass grafts.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intravenous tPA Thrombolytic Therapy Initiation At Hospital Tissue Plasminogen Activator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Intravenous tPA thrombolytic therapy at hospital initiation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Intravenous Tissue Plasminogen Activator Thrombolytic Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel.:Tissue plasminogen activator (PLAT) is a serine protease that activates the proenzyme plasminogen to plasmin, which in turn is responsible for fibrinolytic activity. PLAT is synthesized in vascular endothelial cells as a single polypeptide chain. Proteolytic cleavage of the single chain protein at a centrally located arginine-isoleucine bond by plasmin gives rise to a 2-chain disulfide-linked form, composed of the N-terminally derived heavy chain and the C-terminal light chain.:Use of infusions of fibrinolytic agents to destroy or dissolve thrombi in blood vessels or bypass grafts.

Concepts.definition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein.

Tissue-type plasminogen activator (562 aa, ~63 kDa) is encoded by the human PLAT gene. This protein plays a role in the cleavage of plasminogen between Arg-580 and Val-581 to form the fibrinolytic enzyme plasmin.
Any pharmacologic intervention used to destroy or dissolve a clot in a blood vessel or graft.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate position, location, or state (American Heritage Dictionary):An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate position, location, or state.
An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NINDS:National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke Common Data Element Project
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/25/18 - smt CDE transferred to NCIP ownership per NINDS (Muniza Sheikh) request.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
